learning_outcomes.description: Analyse corporate performance to inform managerial decisions (product, service, segment and customer profitability, break-even analysis, the effect of transfer prices on segment profitability).
Develop a balanced scorecard for measurement of corporate strategy implementation.
Prepare a master budget and pro-forma financial statements for a real startup in a team project.
Understand the implications of performance measurement and rewarding on employee motivation and decision making.
Learn regulatory requirements and experience managerial considerations of corporate social responsibility and ethics.

assessments.assessment_title: Team Project Report on Financial Projections
assessments.task_description:
Preparation of financial projections and performance analysis for a startup. Students complete this project in teams of four. One project write-up should be submitted per team.

The project write-up must not exceed 3,000 words. An excel file will also be submitted along with an 8 minute video presentation.

In addition, there will be a written reflection exercise (peer assessment) for each team member to complete individually using the template that will be provided on Ultra.

This individual reflection will require you to assess the contribution of your fellow team members.

AI Statement:

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. 

Use of GenAI strictly prohibited

It is very important for this assignment to maintain the confidentiality of the startups' information you are working with. As you are handling sensitive and confidential information related to our founders, it is strictly forbidden to upload or share this information on any Generative AI (GenAI) platforms.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written and oral submission
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignment to be submitted via the Blackboard assessment link on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
In this simulation game, students experience the benefits and challenges of using a scorecard to implement strategic initiatives and monitor firm performance.

Students choose a strategy for their company, create a strategy map, develop a balanced scorecard, choose initiatives to implement their strategy, and use feedback from the balanced scorecard to adjust their implementation approach over a series of 8 rounds.

At the conclusion of the simulation, each student's company will be purchased by a private investor.

The goal of the simulation is to maximise firm value at the time of buyout - the buyout price being based on the company's financial position and future prospects.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
The assessment consists of six short quizzes that are directly linked to the case studies discussed during class sessions. Each quiz is worth up to five marks, and students will complete one quiz at the end of each relevant session. To encourage consistent engagement while allowing flexibility, only the best four quiz scores will count toward the final grade, contributing a total of 20 marks.

Quizzes are designed to assess students’ understanding of the concepts applied in the case studies and their ability to interpret and analyse information discussed during the session. They are administered exclusively in the classroom under supervised conditions to ensure authenticity and integrity of assessment. Students are required to complete the quizzes individually, without external assistance or the use of AI tools.
